reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: WASH in Jibreen IDPs Shelter in Rural Aleppo - Syria

description.narrative:
In light of ongoing fighting in “Aleppo Governorate” which led to continuous displacement and a significant increase in IDPs. Aleppo government is looking for prepare a location in a safe area in Aleppo rural to be able to hosting increased numbers of IDPs by providing the proper accommodation requirements.
Jibreen IDPs collective shelter is one of the most vulnerable location in Aleppo rural where about 1500 household expected to be potentials beneficiaries. All of them will live in unfinished industrial halls suffering from shortage in WASH facilities, and a lot of them having no access to safe drinking water and proper sanitation facilities.
The most vulnerable groups (Children amp Women) are particularly vulnerable in this emergency context, exposed to major risk of lack of water, sanitation services, and lack of hygiene services and awareness. There is a single water point source serving the the whole population thereby overburdening women and children who spend most of their time collecting water other than engaging in other productive activities such as schooling.
Furthermore, previous stakeholder involvements (UN agencies, NNGOs and INGOs.) in these halls during 2015-2016 were not enough to solve the problem, it was working on "partially solutions" according to numbers of IDPs resettled in the shelter, and this project will act to complete the WASH works especially the external works in all industrial halls. So, the project aim to solve this problem by
1- Accessing safe water through implementing a temporary fresh water net to reach to 440 halls. 2- Provide external sanitation facilities to 288 halls.
This will protect thousands of people who are expected to move to the mentioned location (1500 household) . By implementing the project, more than 288 household will have access to fresh and safe water and about 440 household will benefit from sanitation facilities.
Fouadi believes of the importance of coordination and therefore it will work to have open channels with the relevant governmental bodies, concerned sectors, UN agencies, NNGOs and INGOs which already have intervention in the location.
